sen.j: 登録有形文化財（とうろくゆうけいぶんかざい）は、1996年の文化財保護法改正により創設された文化財登録制度に基づき、文化財登録原簿に登録された有形文化財のことである。
sen.e: Registered Tangible Cultural Properties are the tangible cultural properties that are registered on the book of registration of Agency for Cultural Affairs in accordance with the registration system for cultural properties established under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties amended in 1996.

Registered Tangible Cultural Properties are the tangible cultural properties that are registered in the book of registration at the Agency for Cultural Affairs, in accordance with the registration system for cultural properties established under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties amended in 1996.

Registered Tangible Cultural Properties are the tangible cultural properties that are registered in the book of registration at the Agency for Cultural Affairs, in accordance with the registration system for cultural properties established under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties amended in 1996.

sen.j: 登録対象は当初は建造物に限られていたが、2004年の文化財保護法改正により建造物以外の有形文化財も登録対象となっている。
sen.e: Although only architectures were registered initially, the amendment of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties in 2004 expanded the system to include tangible cultural properties other than architectural structures.

Although only buildings were registered initially, the amendment of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties in 2004 expanded the system to include tangible cultural properties other than architectural structures.

Although only buildings were registered initially, the amendment of the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties in 2004 expanded the system to include tangible cultural properties other than architectural structures.

sen.j: 登録物件は近代（明治以降）に建造・製作されたものが主であるが、江戸時代のものも登録対象になっている。
sen.e: Cultural properties of Edo Period can be candidates to registration, while most items registered were built or made in the modern times (in or after Meiji Period).
Cultural properties of the Edo Period can be candidates for registration, however most items registered were built or made in modern times (in or after the Meiji Period).
Cultural properties of the Edo Period can be candidates for registration, however most items registered were built or made in modern times (in or after the Meiji Period).

sen.j: 概要
sen.e: Overview
Overview
Summary

sen.j: 登録制度創設の背景
sen.e: Background of the registration system for cultural properties
Background of the registration system for cultural properties
Background of the registration system for cultural properties

sen.j: 1996年の文化財保護法改正により、従来の文化財「指定」制度に加えて、文化財「登録」制度が創設された。
sen.e: In addition to the conventional "designation" system for cultural properties, the "registration" system for cultural properties has been established under the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties amended in 1996.
In addition to the conventional "designation" system for cultural properties, the "registration" system was established under the 1996 amendment to Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties.
sen.cmt: Repetition of 'for cultural properties' is unnecessary I think. 再構成しました。
sen.e: In addition to the conventional 'designation' system for cultural properties, the 'registration' system was established under the 1996 amendment to Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦以降の日本においては、急激な都市化の進展などにより、近世末期や近代以降の多種多様な建造物が、その建築史的・文化的意義や価値を十分認識されないまま破壊される事例が相次いだ。
sen.e: In Japan right after the Second World War, along with the rapid urbanization, a variety of architectural structures built in and after the end of Edo Period were pulled down one after another, without being recognized of their historical and cultural values.

In Japan after the Second World War, one effect of the rapid urbanization was that a variety of architectural structures built in and after the end of the Edo Period were pulled down one after another, without regard to their historical and cultural value.
sen.cmt: 「right」削除, 「along with」→「one effect of」,「was that」挿入, 「the」挿入, 「being recognized of」→「regard to」,「s」削除
sen.e: In Japan after the Second World War, one effect of rapid urbanization was that a variety of architectural structures built in and after the end of the Edo Period were pulled down one after another, without regard to their historical and cultural value.
sen.cmt: 文法間違い。 “ one effect of the rapid urbanization”=> “ one effect of rapid urbanization ”

sen.j: このような反省に立ち、昭和40年代頃から、近世の民家建築、近代の洋風建築などが国の重要文化財や、地方公共団体の文化財に指定される例が漸増していった。
sen.e: After governments paying attention to these facts, gradually increasing number of traditional private houses from Edo Period and Western-style architectures of modern times have been designated as national important cultural properties or as cultural properties by local governments.

Following a greater appreciation of this situation, a gradually increasing number of traditional private houses from the Edo Period and Western-style buildings of modern times have been designated as national important cultural properties or as cultural properties by local governments.
sen.cmt: 「After governments paying attention to these facts」→「Following a greater appreciation of this situation, a」, 「architectures」→「buildings」 (throughout this article), 「the」挿入,再構成しました。
sen.e: Following a greater appreciation of this situation, a gradually increasing number of traditional private houses from the Edo Period and Western-style buildings of modern times have been designated as national important cultural properties or as cultural properties by local governments since the late 1960s.

sen.j: しかし、急激に消滅しつつある近代の建造物の保護にあたっては、国レベルで重要なものを厳選する重要文化財指定制度のみでは不十分であり、より緩やかな規制のもとで、幅広く保護の網をかけることの必要性が議論された。
sen.e: However, there were arguments of necessities for wide spread and overall protection measures under less strict regulations, because the resignation system for important cultural properties, under which the nation strictly selects items for resignation, was not powerful enough to preserve rapidly decreasing architectures of modern times,.

However, there were arguments regarding the necessity of widespread overarching protection measures with less strict stipulations, because the designation system for important cultural properties at national level had strict criteria, and was not powerful enough to preserve the rapidly decreasing number of modern buildings.
sen.cmt: I think the original translation is a bit confusing, as I think it was the strictness of the criteria which meant that many buildings could not be designated as important cultural properties.
sen.e: However, there were arguments regarding the necessity of widespread overarching protection measures with less strict stipulations, because the designation system for important cultural properties at national level had strict criteria, and was not powerful enough to preserve the rapidly decreasing number of modern buildings.

sen.j: こうして、重要文化財指定制度を補うものとして創設されたのが、文化財登録制度であり、登録された物件を登録有形文化財と称する。
sen.e: For this reason, the registration system for cultural properties was established to complement the designation system for important cultural properties, and registered objects are called Registered Tangible Cultural Properties.

For this reason, the registration system for cultural properties was established to complement the designation system for important cultural properties, and registered objects are called Registered Tangible Cultural Properties.

For this reason, the registration system for cultural properties was established to complement the designation system for important cultural properties, and registered objects are called Registered Tangible Cultural Properties.

sen.j: 登録の対象
sen.e: Properties subject to registration
Properties subject to registration
Properties subject to registration

sen.j: 1996年の文化財保護法改正の時点では、登録の対象は当面建造物のみとされ、美術工芸品、歴史資料などは登録対象となっていなかった。
sen.e: The Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties amended in 1966 restricted the resignation to only architectural structures excluding arts and crafts, and historical written materials.
The 1996 Amendment to the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties restricted the designation to only architectural structures, and excluding arts and crafts and historical written materials.
sen.cmt: 「1966」→「1996」, 「resignation」→「designation」(throughout this article). 再構成しました。The original law is not the subject, the amended law is here.
sen.e: The 1996 Amendment to the Law for the Protection of Cultural Properties restricted the designation to only architectural structures, and excluding arts and crafts and historical written materials.

sen.j: この理由は、建造物に関しては、都市化や開発の進展、生活・居住形態の変化などにより、取り壊される可能性があり、緊急に保護措置をとる必要があるためであった。
sen.e: The reason for this was that there was need for urgent measures to protect architectural properties that were in danger of dismantling due to the urbanization, land developments, and changes of people's lives and ways of residence.

The reason for this was that there was a need for urgent measures to protect properties that were in danger of being dismantled due to urbanization, land development, and changes in people's lifestyles and ways of living.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入,「architectural」削除, 「dismantling」→「being dismantled」, 「the」削除, 「s」削除, 「lives and ways of residence」→「lifestyles and ways of living」,
sen.e: The reason for this was that there was a need for urgent measures to protect properties that were in danger of being dismantled due to urbanization, land development, and changes in people's lifestyles and ways of living.

sen.j: なお、2004年の同法改正により、建造物以外の有形文化財についても登録の対象となった。
sen.e: The amendment of the law in 2004 made also tangible cultural properties other than architectures subject to resignation.
A further amendment of the law in 2004 made tangible cultural property other than buildings also subject to designation.
A further amendment of the law in 2004 made tangible cultural property other than buildings also subject to designation.

sen.j: この登録制度は指定制度を補完するものであるため、登録対象となる有形文化財は、国や地方公共団体の指定を受けていないものに限られる。
sen.e: Only tangible cultural properties that are not designated by the nation or local public bodies could be registered, because this system is complementary to the designation system.
Only tangible cultural properties that have not been designated by the nation or local public bodies can be registered, because this system is complementary to the designation system.
Only tangible cultural properties that have not been designated by the nation or local public bodies can be registered, because this system is complementary to the designation system.

sen.j: 登録有形文化財として登録された後、国または地方公共団体の文化財として指定を受けた場合は、登録有形文化財としての登録は抹消される。
sen.e: If a property is designated as a cultural property by the nation or by a local public body after the registration, the item will be deleted from the registration.
If a property is designated as a cultural property by the nation or by a local public body after registration, the item will be deleted from the registration.
If a property is designated as a cultural property by the nation or by a local public body after registration, the item will be deleted from the registration.

sen.j: ただし、地方公共団体の文化財として指定を受けた場合において、その登録有形文化財について、その保存及び活用のための措置を講ずる必要があり、かつ、その所有者の同意がある場合は、例外的に登録を抹消しないことができる。
sen.e: If a property is designated as a cultural property by a local public body and there is a need for implementation of measures to protect and utilize it, and also if its owner agrees, deletion can be avoided as an exceptional case.

If a property is designated as a cultural property by a local public body and there is a need for the implementation of measures to protect and utilize it, and also if its owner agrees, deletion can be avoided as an exceptional case.

If a property is designated as a cultural property by a local public body and there is a need for the implementation of measures to protect and utilize it, and also if its owner agrees, deletion can be avoided as an exceptional case.

sen.j: また、2004年の法改正においては、有形民俗文化財、記念物（史跡・名勝・天然記念物関係）についても従来の「指定」制度を補完するものとして「登録」制度が導入された。
sen.e: The amendment of the law in 2004 introduced the "registration" system to complement the conventional "designation" system to include Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and monuments (historic sites, places of scenic beauty, and natural monuments).

The amendment of the law in 2004 extended the "registration" system complementing the conventional "designation" system to include Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and monuments (historic sites, places of scenic beauty, and natural monuments).

The amendment of the law in 2004 extended the 'registration' system complementing the conventional 'designation' system to include Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and monuments (historic sites, places of scenic beauty, and natural monuments).

sen.j: 登録された有形民俗文化財および記念物はそれぞれ登録有形民俗文化財、登録記念物と呼ばれる。
sen.e: After Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and monuments are registered, they are called Registered Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and Registered Monuments, respectively.
After Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and monuments are registered, they are called Registered Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and Registered Monuments, respectively.
After Important Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and monuments are registered, they are called Registered Tangible Folk Cultural Properties and Registered Monuments, respectively.

sen.j: 登録有形文化財（建造物）
sen.e: Registered Tangible Cultural Properties (Architectural structures)
Registered Tangible Cultural Properties (Structures)
Registered Tangible Cultural Properties (Structures)

sen.j: 2008年5月1日現在、建造物の登録件数は6,824件である。
sen.e: As of first of May, 2008, 6,824 architectural structures have been registered.
As of first of May, 2008, 6,824 architectural structures have been registered.
As of first of May, 2008, 6,824 architectural structures have been registered.

sen.j: 登録されている物件の一覧を見ると、以下のような多様な分野の建造物が登録されている。
sen.e: The list of registration shows architectures of a variety of fields are registered as follows:
The registration list shows a variety of buildings are registered:
The registration list shows a variety of buildings are registered:

sen.j: 役所、図書館、学校、駅舎などの公共建築
sen.e: Public architectures, such as government offices, libraries, schools, and stations
Public buildings, such as government offices, libraries, schools, and train stations
Public buildings, such as government offices, libraries, schools, and train stations

sen.j: 軍隊関連施設
sen.e: Military facilities
Military facilities
Military facilities

sen.j: 伝統産業施設
sen.e: Traditional industry facilities
Buildings relating to Traditional Industry
sen.cmt: 再構成しました。'Facilities' sounds a little unnatural in some cases, so I have changed this and similar instances below.
sen.e: Buildings relating to Traditional Industry

sen.j: 店舗、銀行、旅館、ホテルなどの商業建築
sen.e: Business facilities, such as stores, banks, inns, and hotels
Business facilities, such as stores, banks, inns, and hotels
Business facilities, such as stores, banks, inns, and hotels

sen.j: 工場などの産業関連施設
sen.e: Industrial facilities such as factories
Industrial buildings such as factories
Industrial buildings such as factories

sen.j: トンネル、橋梁、灯台などの交通関係建造物
sen.e: Structures for transportation, such as tunnels, bridges, and lighthouses
Structures relating to transportation, such as tunnels, bridges, and lighthouses
Structures relating to transportation, such as tunnels, bridges, and lighthouses

sen.j: ダム、水門などの近代化遺産
sen.e: Heritage from the modernization, such as dams and water gates
Structures relating to modernization, such as dams and water gates
sen.cmt: Heritage' clashes a little with modernization.
sen.e: Structures relating to modernization, such as dams and water gates

sen.j: 社寺、教会などの宗教建築
sen.e: Religious architecture, such as temples, shrines, and churches
Religious structures, such as temples, shrines, and churches
Religious structures, such as temples, shrines, and churches

sen.j: 民家、泉（飲料用水、生活用水）
sen.e: Private houses, fountains (water to drink and for daily use)
Private houses, fountains (both for drinking water and for daily use)
Private houses, fountains (both for drinking water and for daily use)

sen.j: これらの登録物件には、現役の商店、ホテルなどとして活用しつつ保存されているもの、博物館・資料館などとして公開活用されているものが多い。
sen.e: Many of these registered items are preserved being utilized as running shops and hotels, or open to the public as museums or archives of historical resources.
Many of these registered items are both being preserved and utilized as shops and hotels, or open to the public as museums or archives of historical resources.
Many of these registered items are both being preserved and utilized as shops and hotels, or open to the public as museums or archives of historical resources.

sen.j: 登録有形文化財（美術工芸品）
sen.e: Registered Tangible Cultural Properties (Arts and crafts)
Registered Tangible Cultural Properties (Arts and crafts)
Registered Tangible Cultural Properties (Arts and crafts)

sen.j: 建造物以外の有形文化財（美術工芸品）の登録有形文化財についてどのようなものが該当するかは、改正された「登録有形文化財登録基準」（文部科学省告示）に定められている。
sen.e: The amended "Standard for Registration of Tangible Cultural Properties" (notified by Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) defineswhat tangible cultural properties (arts and crafts) other than architectures are subject to registration.
sen.cmt: 登録有形文化財登録基準→Standard for Registration of Tangible Cultural Properties[定訳不明]
sen.e: The amended "Standard for Registration of Tangible Cultural Properties" (notified by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) defineswhich tangible cultural property relating to arts and crafts are suitable for registration.
sen.cmt: 「the」挿入, 「what」→「which」, 「subject to」→「suitable for」,「」挿入, 「」→「」, 「」→「」. I don't think the reference to 'other than buildings' need to be translated as it makes the sentence feel a little clumsy.
sen.e: The amended 'Standard for Registration of Tangible Cultural Properties' (notified by the Ministry of Education, Culture, Sports, Science and Technology) defines which tangible cultural property relating to arts and crafts are suitable for registration.

sen.j: これによると、製作後50年を経過したものであって、歴史的・系統的にまとまって伝存したもの、系統的・網羅的に収集されたもの、すなわちコレクション等の一括資料になっているものあり、かつ、文化史的意義、学術的価値および歴史上の意義を有するものが登録対象となっている。
sen.e: According to the standard, a property must satisfy all of the following conditions for registration: having been historically and systematically inherited; having been systematically and exhaustively collected, or existed as a collection; and having cultural-historic, academic, and historical values.

According to the standard, a property must satisfy all of the following conditions for registration: having been historically and systematically preserved; having been systematically and exhaustively collected, or having existed as a collection; and having cultural-historic, academic, and historical value.

According to the standard, a property must satisfy all of the following conditions for registration: having been historically and systematically preserved; having been systematically and exhaustively collected, or having existed as a collection; and having cultural-historic, academic, and historical value.

sen.j: 第1回の登録は2006年3月30日付けで行われ（官報告示は翌3月31日）、次の4件が登録された。
sen.e: The following four items were registered as the first registration on March 30, 2006 (the official notice was on March 31):
The following four items were registered in the first registration on March 30, 2006 (the official notice was on March 31):

Arita Porcelain (SHIBATA Collection): 10,311 items (the Kyushu Ceramic Museum)
